    • Constructor Detail

      • Elevator

        public Elevator()
        Creates a new Elevator with default values

      • Elevator

        public Elevator(int direction,
                int currFloor)
        Creates a new Elevator with no passengers
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction of the Elevator, -1 means down, 1 means up, and 0 means it currently has no direction
        currFloor - the floor on which the Elevator will start

      • Elevator

        public Elevator(int direction,
                int currFloor,
                int[][] floors)
        Creates a new Elevator with no default values.
        Parameters:
        direction - the direction of the Elevator, -1 means down, 1 means up, and 0 means it currently has no direction
        currFloor - the floor on which the Elevator will start
        floors - an array of arrays each of which hold the number of passengers destined for a floor (first value) and a 0 or 1 flag to indicate whether the Elevator should stop at that floor (second value)

    • Method Detail

      • getNumFloors

        public static int getNumFloors()
        Returns:
        numFloors the number of floors in the building

      • getDirection

        public int getDirection()
        Returns:
        direction the current direction of the elevator ()

      • getCurrFloor

        public int getCurrFloor()
        Returns:
        currFloor the floor the Elevator is currently on (0 indexed)

      • getCurrFloor

        public int getCurrFloor(boolean oneIndex)
        Parameters:
        oneIndex - whether or not to convert the current floor to a 1 indexed value, like the variable numFloors. True returns a 1 indexed floor number, while False returns a 0 indexed floor number.
        Returns:
        currFloor the current floor number, either 1 indexed or 0 indexed based on the value of the parameter

      • getFloors

        public int[][] getFloors()
        Returns:
        floors the array containing floor and passenger information for this Elevator
        See Also:
        Elevator(int direction, int currFloor)

      • getNumPassengers

        public int getNumPassengers(int floor)
        Returns the number of passengers destined for a given floor
        Parameters:
        floor - the floor for which you want the number of passengers
        Returns:
        numPassengers the number of passengers destined for the specified floor

      • getNumPassengers

        public int getNumPassengers()
        Returns the total number of passengers, regardless of the floors for which they are destined
        Returns:
        numPassengers the number of total passengers in the Elevator

      • move

        public void move()
        Moves the Elevator, making appropriate changes to state: Change Elevator direction if necessary Change current floor Disembark all passengers on the new floor

      • boardPassenger

        public void boardPassenger(int floor)
        Adds 1 new passenger to the Elevator, destined for the specified floor
        Parameters:
        floor - the floor for which the passenger is destined

      • boardPassengers

        public void boardPassengers(int floor,
                            int numPassengers)
        Adds 1 or more passengers to the Elevator, all destined for the specified floor
        Parameters:
        floor - the floor for which the passengers are destined
        numPassengers - the number of passengers to board (integer greater than 0)

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
